title: Drawing, "International Casino: Cashier's Booth", August 4, 1937
medium: Graphite, blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamps: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite dimensions, instructions, materials throughout; inscribed in graphite in stamp: 546-83; 1 1/2" = 1'-0"; International; H / D / 8/4/37 / 8/12/37 Ols.; 8/4 1 EMPIRE / 2 BRECKER / 8/13/37 1 BRECKER / " 1 EMPIRE; lower center: NOTE- MAKE 2 DOOR ON RIGHT AS PER SKETCH/MAKE 2 " " LEFT AS SKETCH REVERSED; upper right: NOTE/SKETCH AS SHOWN/WITH DOOR ON RIGHT SIDE/ONE CASHHOLE & ONE INFORMATION HOLE ON/BOTH FRONT & LEFT SIDES; center right: CASHIERS BOOTHS FOR/INTERNATIONAL CASINO/BLEACHED MAPLE FINISH/INSIDE & OUTSIDE
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for cashier's booth. Upper half of booth in plate glass, lower half in bleached maple. Door on right side, information hole and cash hole at front and left side. Drawer and shelf below counter inside booth.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "International Casino: Cashier's Booth", August 4, 1937.
August 4, 1937. Graphite, blue color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-217.
